name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Denver Boulder - Louisville

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: I found everything to my satisfaction and would definitely stay here again. All staff members were professional, courteous and helpful. The room was clean and the maid service met my standards (I was there for 12 days).

Breakfast was prompt and there seemed to be something for most people (cereal, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, bagels, muffins, toast, waffles, juices, coffee, tea and all the trimmings). The lobby area was always kept clean and provided a sitting area and coffee around the clock.
reviews.title: Great property
Nice place, good rates
reviews.text: I used the exercise room a couple of times for the treadmill (couldn't get out those days to run due to snow-- but great running trails nearby), and found the room to be clean and the equipment in good working condition.

My long stay (and running) also necessitated use of the laundry room. I had no problems there, although the washing machine was on the small side. There was no change machine (or laundry product dispenser), but I easily changed bills for quarters at the front desk. I suppose they sell detergent etc. in the little shop by the front desk (I packed some with me, so I didn't look).
reviews.title: Stayed one night

reviews.text: One thing I found odd, so maybe worth mentioning-- several hotel guests who ordered food (pizza, etc) left their food trash in the hallways. Perhaps room service tells them to do this. ???
reviews.title: Great value with small concerns!

reviews.text: I was on a training course with the company in Boulder and I decided to take a week off afterwards to tour the area around Denver, Estes Park and Rocky Mountains Nat'l Park and we used this hotel as the base , my brother and a friend flew from Italy and we stayed a couple of nights in the La Quinta Inn in Louisville. Everything was great, the room was clean, the price very good, the staff was very helpful and kind, we were away for a few days returning in the weekend and they even allowed us to keep our big suticases in the storage room of the hotel so we could be away for a few days just carrying our backpack before returning to the hotel the night before we flew back to Italy from Denver. Probably if there is anything I would try to improve, is the morning breakfast, but said that overall we had a very positive experience and we would certainly return
reviews.title: Great Stay
Amazing!
reviews.text: We arrived at 9 oclock at night and took maybe 5 minutes to check in. Slept like a baby on the comfortable beds.

It's just about a 10 or 15 minute drive from Boulder, just about 2 blocks from highway 36. The hotel is very clean, the room nicely decorated and the staff fantastic. I am staying here while I'm waiting for workers to finish renovating a house I'm going to be renting. Since I'm here for more than just a few days, one of the staff - Lina - brought me a combo microwave/fridge so I won't have to eat out every meal. It was greatly appreciated. There's a free breakfast which is okay - waffles, toast, bagels, muffins, juice, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, coffee and fruit. The free wireless works very well everywhere in the hotel. There's a computer with a printer in the lobby which I've used a few times when I've needed to print something out. The place has a nice size swimming pool and hot tub. And, very important to me, this place is very dog friendly. Dogs are allowed anywhere in the hotel except for the breakfast room - on a leash of course. There's plenty of grass outside and lots of places nearby to walk my dog. In fact, there's a very large dog park not more than a five minute drive from the hotel. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling thru the Boulder area.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with a dog

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel, which is about 10 minutes from downtown Boulder, on a recent business trip. Actually, my company's travel agency recommended it. It was convenient to where I was going and had a free breakfast, so I made the reservations without any particular expectations. But what I found was a very modern hotel with good accommodations, hypo-allergenic bedding, good internet, a clean bathroom and bedding, and good air-conditioning. The room was small, but it had everything I needed for a 2-night business trip, and it was quiet. The hotel is very convenient to Highway 36 and has a large Albertson supermarket, as well as several fast-food restaurants within a 5 minute drive.The breakfast was nothing to brag about - hard boiled eggs, waffles, muffins, coffee, fruit juices, etc. - but not bad, and it came free with the room. The dining area was a bit crowded, but not intolerable. The rooms only cost about $80 per night, so it seemed like a real bargain. I recommend this as a good place to stay for a short-term (1 week or less) visit to the Boulder area (vacation, business trip, just passing through, etc.).
reviews.title: Great Value - Good hotel, low price, but clean and convenient to Boulder.

reviews.text: Conveniently located to Denver, Rocky Mountain and Estes Park. Clean and friendly staff with super pool and hot tub. This Hotel is definitely recommended. Good base camp for all the nearby attractions and sites. Even had cell phone reception!
reviews.title: Great Place
Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: We stayed here while in town for a wedding. The staff was very friendly and accomodating from the minute we entered the front door. Check-in was extremely quick and efficient. The facility was super clean and our room & beds were clean and very comfortable. The location is close to about anything you would need. We would definitely stay here again!

After checking out and returning home across the country, I realized I forgot a shirt in the closet in my room. This was a Masters Tournament shirt that could not be replaced (as you may know, Master's merchandise is not available or sold by Augusta National online, by mail or otherwise). I called the hotel, and that night the woman on staff (Amanda) informed me she had my shirt, then prepped a USPS shipment, and had it sent the very next day. I have stayed at other hotels and when on the rare occasion I have left something behind, I have been told, "I'm sorry sir, no one found a ____ (belt, tie, etc.) in your room." 5-star service to be sure! I will be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!
Great place with pets
reviews.text: Hotel is extremely pet friendly. Front desk staff understands your pet. They have baggie stations outside the hotel for your pet.
The courtyard pool is a wonderful setting with the trees around. Warm water, plenty of pool towels a very relaxing place.
reviews.title: Nice stay

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Louisville/Boulder Hotel
